description: Installation of External Wall Insulation in white render finish to the rear; like-for-like replacement of windows and external doors with the upgrade of mechanical ventilation.
decision_conditions:
The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

<p>Maximising carbon savings of retrofit works</p><p>Prior to commencement of works, a retrofit statement including full details of the design of the proposed insulation (and any other related retrofit systems including fixings, support and services) must be submitted and approved by the Local Authority, the report must include:</p><p>a. A comparison of the existing and the proposed thermal performances (u value)</p><p>b. A comparison of the existing and the proposed EPC ratings</p><p>c. Specifications of all materials and products used in the proposed EWI system including their specific thermal performance per component and as a system (u value)</p><p>d. Detail drawings (maximum recommended scale 1:20) of the proposed build-up of the EWI (section drawing, elevation drawing, detail of key junctions/interfaces including with the roof/eaves/ground) with commentary on thermal bridging mitigation where applicable</p><p>Prior to the occupation of the development hereby approved, a Final “as-built” retrofit statement shall be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority confirming the following key metrics have been achieved or improved upon the pre commencement figures :</p><p>a) As-built U-values using 'through wall' calculations for each component and relevant datasheets</p><p>b) Final EPC certificate</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and supporting net zero development in accordance with LP55 of the Hackney Local Plan and Section 14 of the National Planning Policy Framework.</p>

<p>Overheating risk</p><p>Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, an overheating risk assessment shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, assessing the residence following a reputable tool, such as the Good Homes Alliance’s Early Stage Overheating Risk Tool, to identify necessary actions.</p><p>a) As built details of any external shading measures such as retractable awnings must be submitted and approved by the Local Authority - those details must include 1:50 drawing, as built specification, provision and location as well as maintenance strategy.</p><p>b) G-Values of glazing systems must be submitted and approved by the Local Authority for all rooms confirming an acceptable G-Value of 0.5-0.6 is being implemented.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and securing sustainable and net zero development and construction, in accordance with LP54 and LP55 of the Hackney Local Plan, SI2, and SI4 of the London Plan, and Section 14 of the National Planning Policy Framework</p>

<p>EPC rating</p><p>Within 6 months of completion of the works hereby approved, the EPC rating certificate shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority confirming that the minimum of a C-rating has been attained.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and supporting net zero development in accordance with LP55 of the Hackney Local Plan and Section 14 of the National Planning Policy Framework.</p>
